citation.article-title: Zhangella mobilis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the family Hyphomicrobiaceae isolated from coastal seawater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Zhangella mobilis sp. nov.
Zhangella mobilis (mo′bi.li.s. L. fem. adj. mobilis motile, pertaining to the motility of the type strain).
Exhibits the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are 1.8–3.3 μm long and 0.4–0.7 μm wide.
Colonies are circular, slightly raised, smooth, pale yellow and 2.0–3.0 mm in diameter after incubation at 30 °C for 2 days on MA.
Growth occurs at 4–42 °C (optimum 36 °C), but not at 0 or 45 °C.
Growth is observed at pH 7.0–10.0 (optimum pH 8.2), but not at pH 6.5 or 10.5.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0.5–7.5 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 2.0 %).
Methyl red and Voges–Proskauer reactions are negative.
Hydrolyses Tween 20 and l-tyrosine, but not gelatin or Tween 40, 60 or 80.
Utilizes glycerol, d-galactose, d-fructose, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, sucrose, trehalose, glycogen, turanose, gentiobiose, potassium 2-ketogluconate and aesculin.

Does not utilize potassium 5-ketogluconate, adipic acid, malic acid, erythritol, d-arabinose, d-ribose, d- or l-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, lactose, melibiose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, xylitol, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d- or l-fucose, d- or l-arabitol, potassium gluconate, capric acid or phenylacetic acid.
Produces acid from d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, d-salicin, cellobiose, maltose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose and gentiobiose.

Produces leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, acid phosphatase, β-galactosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, but not lipase (C14), β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase or β-fucosidase (API ZYM).

Resistant to (μg per disc unless otherwise stated) streptomycin (10) and norfloxacin (10) and sensitive to neomycin (30), polymyxin B (300 U), vancomycin (30), ampicillin (10), carbenicillin (100), ciprofloxacin (5), rifampicin (5), chloramphenicol (30), benzylpenicillin (10), kanamycin (30), erythromycin (15), tetracycline (30), gentamicin (10) and novobiocin (5).
The type strain, E6T (=CGMCC 1.7002T =JCM 15144T), was isolated from coastal seawater of Tianjin, China.
